thobe.widgets.decoratorPanel

Class ProgressPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • thobe.widgets.decoratorPanel.DecoratorPanel
              • thobe.widgets.decoratorPanel.ProgressPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SPComponentDecorator

    public class ProgressPanel
extends DecoratorPanel
    Class/ Panel that will decorate a given Component with a waiting indicator (spinning dial) if the Panel is disabled and optionally an progress bar.
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(int progress)
        Set the value of the progress-bar of the ProgressPanel. Note that the progress-bar is only visible if the ProgressPanel is in state waiting and if the visibility of the progress bar was enabled via setWithProgressbar(boolean).
        Parameters:
        progress -

      • getProgress

        public int getProgress()

      • setWithProgressbar

        public void setWithProgressbar(boolean withProgressbar)
        Control the visibility of the progress bar.
        Parameters:
        withProgressbar - - True: a progress bar will be drawn, False: no progress bar
